private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labeled with vowels: A, E, I
I can move only the block that is currently at the top of a stack
I can pick and place exactly one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so the final configuration has A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on L and L on the table

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks labeled with consonants: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L
I can move only the block that is currently at the top of a stack
I can pick and place exactly one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so the final configuration has A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on L and L on the table

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward
I must keep the action schemas of the two agents distinct so the planner can assign moves to the correct agent
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem compatible with the FastDownward planner that achieves the global block stacking goal while respecting agents' movement constraints

public_information: There are twelve blocks labeled A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L
Initial stacks from top to bottom are: Stack1 top B G J C L F A bottom (B on G on J on C on L on F on A on table); Stack2 top H K I E D bottom (H on K on I on E on D on table)
Only the block at the top of a stack can be moved
Agents can move exactly one block at a time
One agent is restricted to moving vowel-labelled blocks A, E, I and the other is restricted to moving consonant-labelled blocks B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L

The goal configuration is a single stack with top A then B then C then D then E then F then G then H then I then J then K then L on the table (A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on L on table)

analyze.system_prompt: You are the vowel agent. You can only move vowel-labelled blocks A, E, I. You can only move the top block of any stack and only one block at a time. Your task is to analyze the initial public situation and identify, in a structured form, all legal individual moves and any precondition/postcondition patterns that arise from your capabilities. Do not produce final PDDL domain or problem files. Provide a clear list of movable blocks you can act on, the stacks they are on, and the possible target places (table or top of another stack) respecting the top-of-stack constraint. If some information is missing, report it rather than assuming it.
analyze.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Use the public information and your private information to produce a structured description of the moves and constraints you can contribute toward the global goal. Output must be analyzable and explicit about preconditions and effects of your allowed moves.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the consonant agent. You can only move consonant-labelled blocks B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L. You can only move the top block of any stack and only one block at a time. Your task is to analyze the initial public situation and identify, in a structured form, all legal individual moves and any precondition/postcondition patterns that arise from your capabilities. Do not produce final PDDL domain or problem files. Provide a clear list of movable blocks you can act on, the stacks they are on, and the possible target places (table or top of another stack) respecting the top-of-stack constraint. If some information is missing, report it rather than assuming it.
analyze.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Use the public information and your private information to produce a structured description of the moves and constraints you can contribute toward the global goal. Output must be analyzable and explicit about preconditions and effects of your allowed moves.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator and must integrate the analyses from the two agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted for the FastDownward planner. You must keep the agents' actions distinct by providing separate action schemas or predicates for vowel-agent moves and consonant-agent moves, for example move-vowel and move-consonant, or by encoding agent ownership as an explicit predicate. Your PDDL must enforce that only the top block of a stack may be moved, that only vowel agent can move vowels and only consonant agent can move consonants, and that moves transfer a block from one place to another and update top-of-stack and on-table relationships. Produce a domain and a problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and enclose the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Make the domain compatible with FastDownward conventions including types, predicates, and action definitions. If you need to disambiguate object names, integrate the inputs but preserve the semantic roles of both agents.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the two agents' outputs and produce final PDDL domain and PDDL problem files that solve the global stacking goal while respecting the movement restrictions of each agent and the top-of-stack constraint. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>. Target the FastDownward planner.
